sHmM_rt-xGpzPvif6oW6gA.text: Great Irish breakfast, my daughter wants to come back on her birthday she liked it so much

v6sqLOAe1fpDVO4mcWy5NQ.text: Ok first time here was today and there was a Seahawks game on. Apparently this bar is all about Seattle football. ...like hard core. So this I'm sure it not a typical day for them. But the atmosphere was good (football crowd loud).I ordered the chicken wings and wow, they were meaty!  Some of the best I've ever had. Actually my only complaint was the water was horrible,  tasted very metallic. Other then that, had a great time.  The pretzels app was great too!

FuRcNvIvvQFBR96qgUFzaQ.text: Best pub in the valley! The Blacksmiths are beyond compare & they just know how to pour the perfect pint. I'm never more comfortable than I am at Fibber's and I just wish I lived closer so I could go at least once a week. (I live near Casey Moore's, but that's kid stuff. I want the real deal)  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. mmm.....

OejCTpaYgI7TKo--HWUGUw.text: I used to love this place....despite the faint sewer gas smell on the way in the door.....that was until they let their best bartenders go. The food is decent. Prices are slightly on the high side. I love the atmosphere of the bar.....very old Irish inspired wood beams and stained glass everywhere. Very homey. I just wish the staff was as outgoing as the previous folks. The repore just isn't there anymore.

Gh0OXBNC3_CvVMa-kPCCQg.text: All kinds of new CRAFT BEER On Tap, great management, traditional pub food and great live music add up to a great time.  You feel as though you are really there in the UK!  Pretty Cool!

-oghey6Anl1Y-uidBO-cOw.text: Fibbers is within walking distance of our new place and I've been taking advantage lately- you can't go wrong with the happy hour here. Seriously, half price all apps? Sold- and it's great food! Beer is good, pricey though so not the best but the food and ambiance will keep us coming back!

JypFb-UV_ABCEe4xOlEmlg.text: Seriously enjoy this place.  We live near by and it's exactly what It should be, a pub.  The music line up is always stellar.  Free pool is the best.  Although I haven't had the food yet I can't wait to try the fish n chips

PHHm5HhFFixhzMrAXDjPcQ.text: Can't beat their Monday deals! All burgers are $5! I got the Belfast Burger and it was magical! Plus the craft beer of the day is only $3!

MmmEsznTnkbP-uvf7DG8IQ.text: Arizona lacks Irish pubs and this pub is exactly what that is. The bartenders remember you by name and for the most part they know you by drink! Fast friendly service! Their food is also surprisingly fantastic! You wouldn't think a place like this would have such phenomenal food. I love this place!

FXEgQaCxQSQb2PNSGwGxwg.text: Sliders were great and service matched.  The best thing was the dessert...WOW!

wf-BieLb_djY-YV_ZjsR2A.text: Fibber's has always been a decent go-to Irish pub.  Good service, good beer and liquor selection and a decent menu.  The Happy Hour specials are pretty solid as well.  I've noticed over the past year or so that while they've continued to provide a good selection of beers and booze, they food side of things has declined a bit.  A good example would be the "Reuben Bar".  I think it's cool you can pick your bread, (Marble Rye, Multigrain or sourdough), meat (Pastrami, corned beef or turkey), then your choice of slaw or kraut as a garnish. Over the last two weeks, they've been out of various bread options and when the sandwich arrives, it's skinny...my last one probably had two, maybe three slices of pastrami on it, but pretty darn thin, with a sprinkling of kraut.  Tasted good, but for $10 I guess I expect a heartier sandwich.  You can order extra meet for $2, but that would probably get it just about to the point of the normal amount of meat I would expect on a sandwich at that cost.  Not sure why the side salad in place of fries is a $1 more, given the cost of lettuce. For a $1 more I could have ordered the meatloaf dinner that comes with fresh green beans and mashed potatoes. Seems like a much better value.  Service is pretty good overall and I'm sure the servers probably aren't too thrilled with the trivia night crowd on Tuesdays as they don't seem to buy a lot of beer or booze.  Will I continue to go for trivia night on Tuesdays? Yes.  Given the choice of Fibbers, Casey's or Rula, Fibbers would not be my first choice.

tswhCxorFRmDfbA0ugSKZg.text: Happy hour specials are great, food was delicious (get the garlic fries!), and service was excellent.  Will definitely return!

TaCmXil1eGdfm2I5dOU7TA.text: The atmosphere at Fibber Magees is the first thing you notice walking in. Open the door and, if you're there at the right time and day, you're bound to be hit in the ears with live music. The performer (I, unfortunately, did not catch her name) is wonderfully talented. She attempted doing an operatic  piece while I was there the second time and succeeded in spades.   I like their selection of beers and ciders and they have plenty of them on draft. They also have their fair share of good ones not on tap. Having grown up without being able to experience Guinness it's still a novelty for me, but not a favorite. They also have some concoctions like the Snakebite which is half cider and half ale which is not half bad.  Now for the food. The food. Let me preface this by saying I have this thing for garlic. So when I saw fries with garlic sauce on the side, I ordered it immediately. I will now proceed to spend the next fifteen months trying to figure out how to make it. The curry they have on the side with one of their fries is also very good and I suspect it's even better over rice. Their flatbread is exceptional and is something I'm dying to go back and nom on again.  I have two minor complaints, neither of which detracted from my experience. First, the man taking our orders seemed to be spread very thin and was having a hard time getting around making sure everything was filled. On my second visit, that was not an issue, but I made the poor choice of sitting right in front of the singer while she was performing, but that was an oversight on my part.  I should also note that they have a back room with four TV screens playing sports, they have a pool table and darts in back as well as a patio where, presumably you can smoke (assuming we haven't banned that in bars in Arizona). Specials are listed on their website and $3.25 for beers on Sunday? I'll be right there.  This being the case, I'm going back. I love the atmosphere, I love the decor and I love the food. I'd say this is the kind of place you bring a couple friends to kick back a few beers with and just have a good time.

zXXwJJN74RJl6CL8zlWmEw.text: Although, I do not come here that often, I am a big fan of this place.  It's an unpretentious Irish bar, that is a lot of fun.  Of all the proclaimed Irish bars that I have been to in the valley, this is the most Irish of them all.  There's nothing modern about this place, like most Irish bars, so it's nice.  I have only eaten here once and I had the fish and chips and it was quite good.  So if I'm in the neighborhood and I want a drink, I will definately stop on in here!!

wWoB7AFYtDx3UUREh_vaXw.text: On my first visit, the bartender/waiter Brian welcomed with a smile and a handshake. After a few visits, I have become a fan of this quiet and rustic place. On weekends, I sleep in and visit Fibber Magees around mid day for breakfast to watch some game or have my quiet time and hearty breakfast. I love their traditional Irish breakfast that goes well with Irish coffee. The breakfast comes with 3 kinds of sausages and a Bacon, beans or mashed potatoes, grilled tomatoes with some type of great tasting traditional bread. This week, he said he has improved his Irish coffee recipe and showing it off to everyone while he scored to more orders from the girls who were watching. Apparently, there are two versions - The guys' version has floated heavy cream (very slightly whipped) and girls version has fully whipped cream (like Reddi Whip). I think Brian added some Irish mist on top. The original Buena Vista style recpie youtube.com/watch?v=1Vfd...

UYHG2AHyGWLwE65Ld7g4gA.text: I have actually been back to Fibbers quite a few times since the last review and as always its fun and friendly. Fridays ALL you can eat Fish Fry is know to be TASTY! I like to go around 8 for dinner on a Friday  and enjoy friends and food and later around 9;30-10 a great  Irish inspired band will play!  its a place to have fun  but also a place you can feel comfortable bringing your teen kids to for a burger or Cottage pie etc..  The last few times i ran into a few other  people I know. They KNOW FIBBERS is the place ..

RWaGwI6iaI2zebIKSj35-A.text: Great pub with better than average food. Happy hours are a bargin and it seems overlooked for weekday lunch which makes it nicer for those that do go there. Check the live music they have weekend eves. New asian chicken salad on the menu was really good.

6LpwthX5eg4QzZoIu3G06Q.text: What a cool place! Definitely try it on a Monday, where their awesome hamburgers are just a crazy, crazy five dollars. Great happy hour until 7 with half price apps and flatbreads, and cheaper pints. Friendly service, traditional Irish Pub decor, and really good, inexpensive food.

J94Bmr7qarTfB5CEZ_AXEA.text: Fun, local, hole in the wall bar close to home. I have to say I've always had a good time here! Always friendly servers. Very casual atmosphere with things to keep you entertained, darts, pool, and a lot of times live music!

XsBypI2HAESMYGUOCPaAnQ.text: Had a nice late lunch at Fibber Magee's today.  A few drinks, a nice pub-ish atmosphere, and a quiet Saturday afternoon.  The chicken tenders were some of the best I've ever had.  They were almost 1/2 a chicken breast and fried in the same batter you would normally see for the fish of fish and chips.  The burgers looked great and those that ordered them said they tasted just as good as they looked.  The lamb skewers, served with a small salad, were perfect for a light lunch.  I have also been to FIbber's a few times later in the night and have always had a good time.  Live music, real dart board, good drinks and good people.  Fibber's is the kind of place you can hang out in for a long time.

AXUV0fGbVLpOrJZk53nU1Q.text: This place is really a fantastic restaurant with an impressive bar rather than a impressive bar with fantastic food, IMO.  This place is the sister bar to The Skeptical Chymist, but they have different menus. Skeptical Chymist is closer to me but I'd rather drive the 45 min it takes to get to Fibber Magees. They don't have the same menus, which is disappointing.   Without a doubt, you must order the lamb nachos. My favorite, by far, and I always order them. Instead of tortilla chips, the dish comes with lightly fried wonton wrappers, ground lamb, feta cheese, and pico de gallo. The portions are very nice; even when sharing the dish with my husband, it's a lot.   Every day, they have various specials, "dine in" only. My husband loves the $5 burgers on Mondays. They're not skimpy, but nice and meaty. He always cuts it in half bc it is so filling. We've also come in and had their sliders. Those were also very yummy.   Their chicken tenders aren't heavily breaded, but are still fried. I really like those! I have yet to find a place with better chicken tenders. The fish in their fish 'n chips was huge and filling. If you've got a hankering for fish, this will take care of it.

9KcyLOkYmIuo6T9aaYB4XA.text: Oh so close to a five star review.... We have been coming here for a couple of months and love this place! The food is awesome and so is the Dirty Pear that I dream about.  Tonight we tried the pretzels.... What are they thinking? Brown breadsticks? These are NOT pretzels! I can give you a pretzel recipe if you need one. Or you can go down to the Irish pub in downtown Chandler. They have GREAT pretzels.   Let me know if you want that pretzel recipe.

nBc3a_vLz3Eu_gqU8ZZ3UQ.text: Great place! Must try.  Decor is awesome and welcoming Service is friendly and professional Food is delicious!! We had mussels and fish and chips. Both were super flavorful and fresh.  This is a great, legit pub that has an easy going atmosphere

X3R4tRvtErBKRIWoI5boDg.text: My local pub for a few years. Every employee is fantastic. They also have the best salad I have ever had; the blacked chicken Cajun salad.

PWoJEbA1znypyELBTP3O7w.text: The food was delicious, try the garlic fries! Great service and good love music. Very chill environment, will definitely go back!

8_pgmcnsdCzrkMhFex4ihA.text: This is our go to local place. The burgers are great and the fact that they are only $6 each on Monday nights makes them even better. The fish is flakey and cooked to perfection. Sliders aren't my thing, but these were good.  Good food, friendly staff, and a fun atmosphere make it a must go!

VoDfbrJoSCAaZxUL_HweEg.text: Love this place!  Awesome band, great fish and chips and car bombs.  How did I live in Tempe 30 years and miss this!  Yahoo!  Shake and bake.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Awesome band.  How did I live here all these years and not know about this????  Love this bar.

gSOQgzVrCtYji3TH5dxYhg.text: During football season this is a SEAHAWKS BAR!! Such a fun place for Hawks fans to get together to watch our team.  Great game day deals and their food is delicious.

p297VxfOGN8CcRG7OVwuvA.text: Don't let the exterior turn you off. This is actually and very nice pub, friendly staff and nice atmosphere. A little noisy, but a fun place. My husband had the Friday special, all you can eat fish and chips, and it was REALLY good. High quality fish, well prepared. I also recommend the poutine. And of course a well pored Guinness is hard to beat. We will be back.

kWPz7PMdWuusUAeqDGrvxw.text: Authentic Irish atmosphere, Good service, 4 Stars for the Stellar Guinness Pour.  Love the bar, plenty of seating as well as plenty of high top tables to seat at least 5. Guinness is $4.50 on HH which is definitely a better value than a lot of other places we've been.  We tried the medium wings which were meaty & tasty and the Dirty Nellies (Yum!). Consensus on the Fish & Chips, Just Ok. I didn't try it but was told it was a little "mushy." Overall, we'd stop in again when on that side of town.

5tyLnWmk1VB-pQZ61dAfUg.text: I visited for the first time this morning having just moved to Arizona, this being the location where Tottenham Hotspur supporters gather to watch games. The American breakfast and service were great, Bryan and Emma were very welcoming. I saw reviews referring to it being a dive bar, which it is not. I will be trying the Irish breakfast next time in the recommendation of Bryan. Definitely worth a visit.

WJgU4vZpf50SXveyS5zArg.text: Bar is ok, but the old bartenders aren't there anymore. Lost some of that "cheers" feel in the process. Seems more corporate now even though I don't think it is.

VTvdBib0DJWLqZsCPOP_qQ.text: The two stars are for the ambiance in the main bar and the staff, who were lovely. The secondary room is barren and super creepy, the bathroom is regularly wet and gross, and it's not in the fanciest locale.  I paid what I consider to be an outrageous amount for a Fibbers salad, which had spring mix, flimsy cold precooked bacon bits, and flavorless unseasoned boiled chicken breast dumped on it. I wish I had taken a photo- this chicken was grey-white all the way through. My poor waitress did what she could to dress it up with sliced tomatoes, but it was clear she didn't have much to work with. If I pay $12 for a salad, I certainly expect more than this. I've eaten other food here and been reasonably pleased, if not still a bit irked by sticker shock. Clearly they can get away with these prices either because the patrons are drunk or due simply to a lack of competition in the area.  I expected much more and was sorely disappointed with my meal. If you must go, get a meat dish or sandwich, and prepare to pay more than you should. It will at least taste good.  Ps- I was comfortable paying $4 for a side of fries only because they actually make an effort with these. It is the one thing I can honestly recommend is worth the price.

l3JUY0ia-SE55vEXHpMeMQ.text: It was a few weeks ago and I was looking for a place to watch the Seahawks game.  I checked online and certainly didn't want to drive all the way to Scottsdale to the Skeptical Chymist, so this seemed like a great compromise.  I got the Irish breakfast and a Harp lager, and the food was decent.  The service was attentive, which remained impressive when the entire place was packed with Hawks fans.    It was a great environment to watch the game at, and they do a raffle / prizes to keep it interesting and entertaining.  I will be back and would recommend it to any fellow member of the 12th man.

76rDca0mhGLS9D2ugqqrAw.text: Fibber Magees is as good as it gets . . . unless by some small miracle you are transported back to an Irish Pub in Dublin.   We had:  Tempura Beans (Irish?), Dirty Nellies, Fish & Chips, Shepherd's Pie, and a Rasher Burger all washed down by Smithwicks, BlackSmith & a Grimbergen Blond.  All super good Irish pub food - -  with the exception of the Tempura Beans (which were excellent, but Irish?). We could have been sitting in that magical transported Irish Pub.  Ambiance was Irish pub; service was sweet Irish lass friendly and right on top of our needs.   Then . . . we had to step back out into a warm Arizona spring day. Lovely here, but I'd rather be in an Irish Pub.  P.S. Fibber Magees has All-U-Can-Eat Fish & Chips every Friday!

RunVi1Py-8hCuce-JFNl8w.text: Ok... I get it... You are an Irish pub.  Doesn't mean you have to charge high British isle prices.  Holy hell, way way way overpriced.  I expect to get screwed on prices in Scottsdale, but not here.  Food is ok but not worth the premium.  Atmosphere is ok, but not as ritzy as the menu prices lead you to believe. Don't eat here unless you like overpriced food.  Oh, and asking customers to share tables is extra tacky.  And by the way, waitresses are supposed to ask if you need refills... Not disappear to the bar to watch a football game.  Poor service!

Vs8N486TZPjfO9D0cD-1zg.text: Service was very good.  The Flatbread is amazing.  We stopped in drinks and stayed longer than planned... we will be back

zHnpG1j4BX_K5nH07tP6iA.text: One word...amazing! This place is so great! The staff is super friendly, the patrons are great, and the food/drinks are the best around. I've never had a bad experience here and never will! Also, during the football season, they double as a Seahawks bar. GO HAWKS! Trust me, come here and see for yourself. You won't regret it!

cLakI33lGd7XP49cCewKdw.text: I'm more of a party bar type person. Sitting around listening to live music that I've never heard and have no idea how to dance to isn't generally my thing. I've been to FGs when they had parties going on (including St. Patrick's Day) as well as just to get lunch.  It really isn't my thing in either case. If you just want to have more of an Irish time sitting around talking to friends and drinking G, then this is your place.  Still a nice place and food is generally alawys good to me.  St. Patricks is a clusterfuck. Craziness. Fun. Just remember that if you go for this event, don't drive. Don't even drive if you've only had one beer 5 hours ago. Police will sit around FGs and pull you over, pull everyone over, that comes out of that place. I got hauled in for a DUI after the cop said that I made an improper left turn (how convenient of him to make that up so he could pull me over). Luckily I had stopped drinking hours and hours before leaving so I was way under the limit and the case got thrown out.

qIo-8woO1YlPZcquU8B6gA.text: The food was great! Service SUCKS! Waitresses are rude, they were busy and you swat yourself, no income to see us for over 40,missed when they did, the waitress told us basically that we hadn't waitress, acted like she was doing us a favor, rolled her eyes, all we ordered was wings...seemed to be a huge deal. Not happy and prob won't be back, planned on spending a lot of time and money here, cut it short, waited forever, waitresses were mean,totally disappointed.

Z1hAZokxacyO2sfbI8pKjQ.text: The first thing you will notice when you enter Fibbers is the authentic Irish Pub look and feel. We were in Ireland in August so I can attest to that personally. The next thing you will notice is how friendly and accomodating the staff are, from the servers to the bartenders to the kitchen staff everyone has a quick smile and great attitude. Then you will start looking over their great beer, whiskey and scotch selections (although why you would order anything other than Guinness and Paddys is beyond me) and be amazed. Then when your food comes you will get a large portion and terrific taste. Do not  miss out on this little piece of Ireland in the East Valley.

8DvfWB_oe99xW-hi78NvgA.text: I've been a few different times now and every time the food has been great! Service has been a bit iffy (especially tonight after having Amanda as our server) but I will still come back just to sit at the bar. Why? Huge selection of liquor and a rotating selection of speciality beer as well as the best mules I've had at a bar. Most importantly though Dawn is hands down the most amazing bartender I've had anywhere and brings a life to the place that is otherwise nonexistent without her. All five stars go to her because if she wasn't there I would most likely not come back.

buaXYhswrTLECc1hf6JB4A.text: So the best part about Fibber Magees has to be the atmosphere inside! It does feel a lot like an Irish pub and I would even say that the atmosphere is better than some of the other places that I've been to that were similar. Other than that the dining experience was just okay for me. I was really looking forward to getting the fish & chips here before arriving which I did manage to get, however I have to say that I was rather disappointed with it. The chips (fries) were not very good at all and based on that I will not get this again. At least the fish was pretty good however the outside texture was too crispy in my opinion and I've still had better at other places. They also forgot my utensils when the food came which I don't mind that much as they brought them before I even asked.  The atmosphere here is awesome but I'm not too sure if I'll come back here other than maybe the happy hour deals that they have throughout the week.

d2ZGhRSsnFENDiREuzswWA.text: I don't know what's going on right now but that place freakin smells! It's like fecal matter and mothballs. Get your grease traps cleaned or something!

1ZsUApjgWbolitf7eHGLEg.text: I've had some rough nights here but no one to blame besides the nectar of the Irish gods..... Car bombs! Over the last ten years my favorite st Patty's day spot. Yes you have to park across the street and pay cover but everybody and their mother is Irish on St Patty's. Live bands and good food yr round... Feel like local pub vibe on a typical weeknight low light slight grimey and dark bar stools tables etc. Maybe grimey was a strong word but it doesn't smell like a can of febreeze..... Cool attentive staff patio for the smokers and all diff types of booths tables etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Like most legit Irish bar decent single malt and blend scotch. Few bourbon plenty of Irish whiskey and probably close to 20 beers on tap

U53wDgMFn6OR0cJlEIUPxw.text: Good news: Burgers are only $6 on Monday. Bad news: it was overcooked (well instead of medium rare as ordered) and the fries were soggy as if the oil temperature was too low or the oil needed to be changed. Barely touched my food, nearly full plate cleared with no curiosity. The last sentence might be the most troubling.

Y_i-DAKh97hV3prfLeK8kQ.text: I was jonesing for some corned beef and cabbage, so we popped in here last night.  The atmosphere is nice, and the servers were very attentive. That's where the positive remarks ends.    First, my corned beef and cabbage had gravy on it.  GRAVY.  Gross. the soup that my fiance was served was room temperature.  They brought out a new bowl that was slightly above room temperature.   Our bill for 2 beers, one entree, and a bowl of soup was $30.  that's right.  Two bowls of cold soup, and we still had to pay for it.    As we were eating our disappointing food, he looked up and noticed a Liverpool sign.  Liverpool - not in Ireland folks...   Him:  What kind of Irish pub has a Liverpool sign?   Me: The kind that puts gravy on corned beef...   sigh.

3fckLfMTns2Tz_FNg942lA.text: Stopped in here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch by the suggestion of my step-daughter as we asked her to join us for lunch and she suggested Fibber Magee's.  This is an Irish bar, with authentic Irish decor, Irish food and beer of course. When we walked in, my husband noticed the music playing was alternative, and wanted Irish music, so our waitress had the bartender changed it to Irish music, it added to the Irish feel. After studying the menu, I decided on the Fish and Chips. All I can say is HOLY COW the 2 pieces of fish I got were humongous, along with the HUGE pile of fries, with what I would say homemade tarter sauce. I dug into the fish, which was some of the best fish I've had in a long time. The batter was smooth and had an excellent flavor. The fish was cooked perfectly, they brought a bottle of malt vinegar to go on your fish as well. The fries were ok. Not the greatest. But, not bad either. I still cannot believe I ate it all, it was my lunch and supper all in one meal. If we didn't have an afternoon event to go to I would have asked for a doggie bag. Our waitress was attentive, and told us if we liked the Fish and Chips that on Friday's it is all you can eat. So, needless to say, we will be back on a Friday night for the all you can eat fish and chips.

iQUuxIgq4sE5Q61_ofUFlg.text: Fibber Magees is an Irish Pub off of Dobson/Elliot. I used to come to this place to grab a couple Harps with the co-workers after a busy day. Since then the pub has taken on a new dimension as they now caiter to Seahawks gamedays.   On the inside, Fibber has a woodcrafted look with corners, booths, and tables situated here and there. The main bar is in the back while the front side has extra seating. There's also an outdoor patio with an HDTV and lots of cigarette smokers. The feel is definitely Irish pub meets Seahawks bar.  Seahawks gamedays are put on by the Arizona Seahawkers, which means any Hawks gameday requires you show up at least an hour early if you want a good seat. This place must make some serious cash on Hawks games. The fatal flaw about Fibber lies with the woodcrafted look, there's pillars and frames which block out the projector and some of the TVs from seats at an angle.  As for the food, there's not too much I haven't liked here. The Irish burger is tasty, as is the cone of garlic/rosemary fries, and meatloaf sandwich. Their potato leak soup is a little on the cream-of-wheat side and their chili is what I would imagine Irish chili to be. Their chicken strips are beastly, fish and chip breaded style breasts. The scalloped potatoes are worth the extra $1. The BBQ pork sliders looked all right from what I saw. Kind of a mix of bar food and Irish classics. The lamb shepards pie is worth the $10 if you're hungry.

Up49Tf9duUEZemLRdRSO1w.text: Ok. Let me start by saying, I did not eat or drink here. I came here for the Blue Friday 12th Man Rally for the Seahawks before the Superbowl.  The employees who were working this day worked SO hard. It was insane. The place was packed, barely even room to stand at 8am, and these servers were running around like crazy. The food looked and smelled amazing, and they sure seemed to be selling those cocktails! Everyone was so friendly as well.   I just wanted to compliment how hard these people worked. I can only imagine how great of service you'll receive from them on a regular business day.

jVB-KDDDKVxY_pIAtcrnGA.text: A fine Irish establishment. Only missing is the fireplace.  Takes me back to my travels in Ireland

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. St Patricks Day.

gMnuyfaZlWbHMUjeX6sE3Q.text: Great place! It has a fun atmosphere and a great menu. Irish music is always playing to give it a great Irish feel. Friendly staff.  It's a Seattle Seahawks bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wide selection of Irish liquor

4HRJfLIDZiDGDZ5ljgY9vA.text: The burgers are delicious and BIG! Also the Monday special for $6 is still serving the same quality burgers. Music: very Irish Service: very friendly, good and fast Menu card: many items - give it a try

4OstwZkNHZcKpZD9cXKrUQ.text: One of the best Irish bars in Chandler.  Fantastic selection of Irish draft beers and ciders, and live music on some nights.  Great service and great atmosphere to relax and have a few drinks.  Highly recommend stopping by and checking it out any time of the week.

uG2SRONlycMXiYBOlw-S4g.text: My husband and I love Fibbers. We can walk there, and we have historically loved the food, drinks, people, and atmosphere. We went there today and the menu had changed, removing a couple of my favorite items, which was disappointing. We ordered a new item for an appetizer, the Brussels sprouts and were thoroughly disappointed. They were definitely nowhere close to "pan roasted" as described, were terribly underseasoned and undercooked. My husband ordered another new menu item as a meal, the 4 cheese and spinach flatbread. He was unimpressed, but did eat it. I ordered the peppercorn burger with potato crisps. The burger did not have the peppercorn sauce or onion strips as advertised, but was flavorful and cooked as ordered. Instead of potato crisps, which I was weirdly really excited about, I got champ. It was mediocre at best, and again, disappointing because I really wanted the crisps (needed some salty crunch). We have never had this type of experience at Fibbers, and were really upset about how it turned out. We love the staff, the love music, and the happy hour deals. However, the menu change is a huge bummer, as was the complete disregard for our correct order tonight. Might need to find a new watering hole!  :(

tb9Ksf21EAUHYyFoYfweFA.text: I like the atmosphere here. Typical of an Irish pub with a lot of wood features including a large wooden bar. The shepherd pie had all lamb which was a bit much for my taste. I did enjoy the band that was featured for the evening, The Big Fellas, but it was a bit loud making it difficult for conversation.

lIpvcjp33STHVpGsFFyGPw.text: I have driven by this place many times. The thought of an "Irish" pub in Chandler, is ridiculous - but once I went here I thin they are doing nicely with what they got. Not too bad at all. We had some beers, we spoke to the reoccurring patrons and we had ourselves a pretty decent time. Had some Irish Whiskey, and the draft Guinness.

fhynJVDW-HRZ0RwWEPICmg.text: This is one of my favorite post to go to.  The people are wonderful it's relaxed and the delicious chicken fingers are my favorite!!!

X71viArnznrJJjruzXe_RQ.text: Haven't been here in years and decided to try again. The service was superb. Food came out very, very quickly. We had Nellie chips as an appetizer. Straight out those were cold and weird. I wouldn't order again and I ate them, but only because I was starving.  The fish & chips were pretty good. The fish was delicious, flavorful (I guess for fish), and flaky. The french fires were good, not the best french fries ever, but good. We would definitely go back and this visit was better than we remember it all those years ago!

v8yPvL2g0PN8UsQgqKCDQQ.text: Very disappointed with our recent experience at Fibber McGee's; it was the exact opposite of our first experience. The waitress, from the moment we walked in was inattentive, rude and seemed resentful. No greeting at all other than "sit wherever you want". After we seated ourselves it took at least 15 minutes for her to come by so we could ask for menus, she went to get them then tossed them on the table without a word. Another long wait and she finally came back for the order which we placed and then asked her for drink menus. Getting 2 beers took another 10 or 15 minutes. When she brought our meals she just quickly dropped them at the table then turned around and walked off. We waited about 10 minutes before we saw her again so we could ask for utensils and napkins. It was about 10 more minutes before she brought those and tossed them on the table. It was a weeknight, not very busy when we went and we made no special requests (other than asking for menus and utensils) so I can't understand why service was so incredibly slow. I have no idea what her problem or why she exhibited such a bad attitude but it definitely left a negative impression and we haven't been back since.  It's really too bad that a waitress' attitude can make what previously had been a great experience turn into something negative. Our first experience at Fibber McGee's had been very positive and I really want to like this place...maybe sometime we'll give it another try to see what the best two out of three brings.

Wt3j6zVwgunLgJgY4BMKrQ.text: The have a good selection of whiskey and various mixed beer drinks.  It's a large place with plenty of seating.   Aside from that there isnt much else going for it. It's a Seattle Seahawks bar, so depending on your NFL fandom, that either really cool for 1/32nd's of the NFL fans or really douchey and annoying to the rest of us.  The food is below average bar/pub food, the service staff is slow, lazy, lacking professionalism, and disheveled.   The place just has a really awkward vibe to it.  No thanks.

41HB0lar5f3ZqjMpgbWpug.text: Had the corned beef and cabbage today. Saint Patrick's Day.  What is with the dark SALTY gravy?  The cabbage was raw. Mashed potatoes?  No carrots or onions? The corned beef we tough. Who is the cook?

tEILRJW8EVF5fsLXjZLJqQ.text: Some of the best fish & chips you can find in Arizona. All you can eat on Fridays for $14. If you want some good food at a great Irish pub try Fibber Magees

QzR-3S_EDi8mmpGKZSQ9KA.text: Sorry, not impressed!  I felt like we were bothering the waitress.  No drink or food specials for Super Bowl Sunday?  Too bad! And they were out of the corned beef and cabbage.

qHiCz7pTm0RabEGh70vGRQ.text: Great laid back place to have quality food, beer, and mixed drinks. Some old crotchety customers here and there but they don't stay long.  A little too strong on the cliche irish music. Warm and friendly spot to make your bar!

GhmjxAA_OzvAPbi7rI--MQ.text: If you want fish and chips this is the place. Weird smell but huge portions! Drinks are priced about average 5-6$ for a beer. The live music is usually less than impressive but that's to be expected at your local Irish dive bar.

gQmXObMtK0Kic_j49uhnLg.text: Not a bad little pub. Good service and very reasonably priced drinks, especially the daily specials. I didn't have any food, but looked OK. Only problem is that it's a Seahawks bar, so I was told it's packed with Seahawks fans on Sundays during their games...

toh9ZZ6OQY1tP7kk3uRoEQ.text: Great pub. Food here is wonderful. A tad pricey, but that's fine. However, a few months ago there was a new manager that came to town and this place really hasn't been the same since.

GRdTDnXZU_BmQ-40bAlMug.text: Oh man, you know I love me some Fibber Magees. I found this place the first day I moved to Mesa, and I never looked anywhere else. Some of the best bartenders around- Clayton, Will (who's not there anymore, but dammit he should be), Scott, the list goes on. None of them are any less than stellar. And the atmosphere is as close to what I think of as a real Irish pub as I've ever found.   I know what you're thinking- wooden floors, Guinness and an Irish sounding name, and you've got yourself an "authentic" Pub. Nay nay- I looked into it, and one of the bar's owners is from Ireland directly. It's a PUBlic house, meaning yes, you can bring the kids, and nobody's getting offended. Everyone's just getting well fed and having a great time.   Now let's talk about the amenities people- all drink and no play makes Joe a sad boy. At Fibber's, the games abound. They have 2 pool tables, a few arcade games in the back (Buck Hunter and Golden Tee), 3 dart boards, live music all the time (including a Sunday Afternoon Irish Jam), and multiple large flatscreens so you can catch the game, too. This place is almost always a great time, and when it's not, it's because everyone's recovering from the night before. If you want to come and chill out, have a cold one and not be in a meat market on a Friday night, look no further.   Also, they have some of the very best food I've ever eaten in a bar. One word- BURGERS. Before I went vegan, this was the Mecca, the Holy Grail, the Eden of hamburgers. But their flatbreads, their fries, their salads- everything on this menu is amazing. Don't miss the Fish and Chips- make a night of it. Hot wings rule here, too. Oh yes, and they have CHAMP. If you don't know what it is, Google it, order it, eat, repeat.   Fibbers, please oh please move to Portland. Marquam Hill specifically. Until you do, Arizona- you better treat them nice.

33futT5a_Y7n270HlvdDBA.text: Love this place! Garlic fries are awesome, beer is good and love the live performances.

xiEjRyvIEEd4sdHqM2r44w.text: Great Irish breakfasts, and other Irish foods like boxty, shepherd's pie, and corned beef and cabbage.  I can't vouch for the more Americanized foods, but the boxty dishes and shepherd's pie I've tried have been delicious, and although I've never been to Ireland to have an Irish breakfast, it tasted pretty good to me!  They certainly used all the ingredients that one would have in Irish breakfast, including blood sausage (Which tastes quite good, despite the sanguinary name).

vudiZ-rZpePUO7a2O-St2Q.text: I've always enjoyed the atmosphere here.  It's decor feels like a pub to me.  I've only been here a few times but the staff has been nice every time.  No complaints so far on my end.....  One of these days I may actually get around to looking at the menu for food.

JBxKdnDJRXtVZXI4hEefdg.text: Great deals of the day, pool tables and darts and a smoking lounge. All they need a few more scotch's to go with their Irish wiskey collection. Took the kids with us for lunch, they were welcome there but bored stiff.

bwMXYkB62cAo7RIatB5NAA.text: I've gone to this place twice.  I love the bar and the staff.  It's a quirky little place.  The food is okay.  I ordered the same thing on both visits.  I went the first time on a Sunday late morning and the food quality was great.  Tasty, hot and awesome proportions of the "dirty nellies" (potatoes to blue cheese, onion, bacon and sauce).  The second time was a Friday night and the food was decent, but it wasn't the same.  My husband ordered the corned beef.  I tried and it was decent.  Not super flavorful, but not salty (I can't stand that).  The beer selection is great though and I did love that.  I would go back, but I would order something new I think.

kYJra2MR_2RYogoU71ro8A.text: Met a couple here so we could experience the Friday fish fry. We both found it thru Yelp - neither of us had been here prior.   The fish was all you can eat but it was so greasy and heavy on the batter that we couldn't really take advantage of that. The chips were sparse, as was the coleslaw. Plenty of fish to go around.   Enjoyed a few Harp's and of course Guinness is on the menu. Waitress was really lacking in service - asked for waters several times, had to chase her down for beers, offered us more fish before we even started on the first.  We stuck around to hear the band. They were a kick and could actually sing some non-Irish songs! Had some fun and got some good people watching time in (this was just prior to St Paddy's day).  Place is dark and run down inside. Looks like some folks use this as their starter bar. I can't fathom going there again myself - bar, food or otherwise.

EqMtku7GuYJGRA1Jpqxk7g.text: 3.8 stars.  Pretty good pub atmosphere, great chips and pretty good fish, especially for the desert.  My fish could best be described as a plank.  Three good size Cod fillets that were bonded together by the beer batter.  In the traditional English style, I prefer the Haddock fillets but you really only find that in England and New England.  The batter was laid on a bit heavier than I care for but it was still good batter.  The chips were nice long slices...perfect.  The tarter sauce was slightly sweet, I prefer it tangier.  Portions were good, particularly for the fish.  *fyi-  Fibber McGee & Molly was an early and long running radio show and is considered by many to be a precursor to the modern sitcom.

4u244kmvdY0N1Nr-t9gvrg.text: I love an Irish pub, and I love me some Fibber Magee's. My trips are fewer now that I live out in East Hell (Queen Creek), but when I lived in Chandler @ Dobson & Warner, I visited much more often. I still love the feel of this place - the dark wood, the high round tables. I feel like I am back in Dublin.  I used to get the bangers & mash every time I visited, but the past few times my most recent time I went with fish & chips - one of my favorites. I didn't see the bangers on the menu this time, so it may have been changed. The full Irish Breakfast is exactly like I had back at the Tyrrellspass Castle Restaurant on my way to Galway, Ireland.  Wash it down with a Guinness or a Black & Tan. Slainte!

y0JveFHtttBrRW5_J39W9Q.text: An irish bar. Wooden interior, Smithwicks and Guiness, Redbreast and Jameson. I didn't eat but Im willing to bet they serve a mean Shepard's pie.

Ok9AzEF-KyHTBdjWiLXk-Q.text: I love this place! Their garlic fries, muscles and everything else ive tried is amazing! Ive never had a problem with customer service

z3lkNG-2e31qh59IZ4i9lg.text: So enjoyed this place.It was a perfect place to celebrate my birthday. The band was amazing!! Brazenheads...you  really should come give them a listen. Our waitress Melinda was on top of our drinks, and was more than helpful with suggestions!  I shall return!....

ePiSCk_SWU8nsbdzP5BNPA.text: Clean, authentic bar with a rich atmosphere. Bartenders greet you by name and the staff is attentive.  Fresh homemade chips. Not fries. Real Irish chips called Dirty Nellies! A real treat for the pallet. Their wings are delicious.   Don't forget to try the Kilkenny's beer. Frothy fun in a glass. A rich smooth taste served in a cold glass.   By far a great place to bring a group to watch the games. Cheers my friends and stay thirsty!

uEwqnUmjIK7MW7_AmC_T2g.text: Attended a large event (60+) people here for St. Patrick's day. Nothing was delivered as promised, service was horrible, and somehow they ran out of certain food items. The owner was a total jerk when we approached him about the disappointing experience. Don't bother with this place...

Nuv20Jr9SUz43bt6t-pF3A.text: The food here is really good. High quality and It's not like typical greasy pub food.   Great selection of beers, scotches and whiskey too.  Friendly service and great atmosphere.

MPQ7Ib8RDyenMhlb5Po0jA.text: I came back here for a friend's birthday. Our server was Alex. He was very informative . My friend had some dietary restrictions. He went over options that would work with her restrictions. He also made sure the kitchen staff was aware of the restrictions as well. This is great customer service. I started off with pulled pork sliders for an appetizer. I shared them with my wife. They were tender, smoky, and juicy. This was a good indicator of the pulled pork sandwich they offer. For the entree  I decided to try the Belfast burger. This was one of the best burgers I've had. It is a 1/2 pound burger on a brioche bun topped with lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions, roasted red pepper, mushrooms, garlic sauce, an onion ring, and your choice of cheese.(I chose pepper jack) The burger was grilled to a medium well which was my specification. The burger was full of flavor, juicy, and very filling. Almost makes me wish I had not ordered the sliders. I couldn't finish the fries that came with the burger. I also had two Guinness nitro IPA beers. They had happy hour so all appetizers and tap beer was 50%off. I was asked about dessert, but there was no room left. I will be back here later this month for a graduation party.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Belfast burger

tL2jG9W1Fb4286nsT7nTuw.text: Great food, amazing atmosphere, friendly and hardworking staff! Some of the many things you'll find here! The staff is all about giving you a great experience and new ones as well! When stumped on what to drink, the bartender helping us recommended some great choices! Think we have some new favorite beers to choose from! When it came to food, it was hot and served up fast! We recommend this pub as a place you must visit!

jQVzX8q-Wgd0fFO0whhxLA.text: That is simply the Best Burger,  the Belfast.  Parred with a Guinness and it's Paradise.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States

23qd9eRjuult336Ra_24yA.text: The servers were okay. The beer was nothing great and somewhat pricey. The "poutine", however, was absolutely disgusting.   I would not even call it poutine, but grease fries topped with oil slow roasted pork, flavorless bacon bits, and cut up string cheese. 10 bucks for a stomach ache.

SqHDdY97twADd4RalFZn5w.text: We showed up for St Paddys day.  We lasted only 30 mins.  Friendly staff, cold beers, the corn beef was ok, but was overpriced and small portions.  Decent atmosphere, but the back left dining area smells wrong!!!  "Dead body" wrong?  Don't know, but all 4 of us saw an open table back there and turned back because of some terrible smell.  My one star went two stars due to a short bathroom line.  This is my 1st negative rating

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States

oyB6HeBfyszqjeuLztpk3Q.text: This is a huge THANK YOU!  I'm really late in writing this review about St. Patrick's Day 2017. I want to say how much I appreciated the staff at Fibber Magees for providing a meal for 12 that I was able to pick up that very busy morning of March 17th. They could have said no, which is what every other Irish pub said. They could have been rude and dismissive due to our team's procrastination, but they were gracious and accommodating, and actually pulled it off for us. Made me look like a hero to my people, so THANKS to the whole staff at Fibber Magees. We ordered the traditional corned beef and cabbage meal for 12 people, which was well-enjoyed and hastily consumed.  Go raibh maith agat!!

l4R25cAySFEpXKRI9X03LQ.text: Fibbers... Get your act together. This is the 3rd time I've had to deal with incredibly rude wait staff, are you trying to scare off customers or something? I shouldn't be repeatedly made to feel like simply sitting down and ordering food or drinks is a massive inconvenience to your employees. You were a mediocre pub at best to begin with, but now you aren't even at the bottom of my list, you aren't even worth considering.

xNE6-9zlp5v-hcmy2GK5Jg.text: Cute Irish neighborhood pub.  Great selection of Irish beers & a bar keep who know how to mix up traditional brew combinations. Live music most days keeps things lively but not too loud.  Don't miss the mussels!

ItW4ydiwB0SQBrhlcTJd6Q.text: So I stopped into have a drink on the way home. Sat at the bar. First bartender was great. Friendly quick. Then she left before I finished my drink. Second bartender.  Well that's another story. Preceded to talk to the patrons sitting next to me.  By then I had finished my drink. She asked the others if they needed Nything. And kept on moving. Waited. And as she returned to check on the others. Who were obviously regulars. Never asked me if i needed  anyrhing. 10 15 minutes later I had to flag her down to get my check.

UoNHO4tqjcrztCD7bjq8wA.text: The pub has a really cool interior and authentic vibe. The corned beef and cabbage dinner was delicious and the bartender was very friendly.

zG2lzOvjT7-s_1qjFssxkQ.text: I just called this place to make a reservation for around 12 people. First time I called - Someone actually took the call and hung up the second they took it.   Second time I called, I was making sure it was 12 people and before I confirm it, he just hung up on me. This is for a company Happy hour and you guys sure lost a good business. Not even planning on going to this place LIKE IN EVER. RUDEEEE!!!!  Hopefully if the manager is reading this review - please ask the man who just attended my call ( On Sep 12, 1.28pm) to be less rude to the customers. God such negative energy this guy has created. You sure lost all my business, Fibber Magees. I'll find someplace else where they respect and listen to what I actually speak. Can't believe this.

lVZEF_xYeeG6l_FBKKcZwA.text: If you like beers, good vibe, good selection of beers... Good atmosphere for the group (25 guys) so can't mad!

6rgtnDSRyfPtXRKBoxYOHw.text: This past Sunday was my first time in this establishment, and it was not very busy.  I ordered a reuben but I was told they ran out of both Swiss and Monterey Jack cheese.  Pretty pathetic for a restaurant to not notice it was running out of something but even more pathetic it didn't go to the grocery store and buy some so they can get through the afternoon.  DO NOT ORDER THE GARLIC FRIES!!  THEY SUCK!  Extremely salty to the point you can only eat one or two and then you are done.  Alex, the bartender, really didn't do much to make the experience any better or at least take the fries off my check.  Speaking of Alex - how long does it take to pour a Guinness?  HOLY CRAP!!!  When I am the only customer at the bar needing a drink, I should not have to wait 10 minutes for a pint of Guinness.  Completely unacceptable.  The reuben, Guinness, and the live Irish music were good but in general, there are much better places than Fibber Magees.

Q6vwSOM5pq33O49k_mPO7A.text: Best lamb Shepherd pie in town. Loved the atmosphere with loud music and lot of TV's showing the games all around the place. For a lunch hour time this place was packed but the people at this pub took good care of us.  Will return for sure

ByggLPICfhpd9or4p8SAEA.text: We keep going back hoping it will be like the old days there with good prices and quality food.   We are dieing for some good fish and chips but the last 3 times we have been there it really falls flat. The batter is crispy on the outside but is mushy against the fish and falls off the whole fish when you take a bite.   FIBBERS, 4 or 5 years you were our go to place. We went there twice a month.  You need to bring back some sort of happy hour, we really miss the quality of the food from back then and the fact that you knew the staff, it seems like new staff everytime we come in.

ZVo8Yd8MChklt-HMhpD0UQ.text: The atmosphere and food were both amazing! We had a great waiter too! Fish and chips were really good so were the Dirty Nellies. We will definitely be back!

Y3rwHsR_rVqqRFccDWT7dw.text: well, the place always had kind of a musty smell, but  , OMG - what has happened?? I went in yesterday because I was dying to eat the best thing on your menu - The Asian Nachos, and I was punched in the stomach with a smell of feces, sewer, poop, or whatever died in your place. I had to hold in my gagging reflex. I stayed only because I was meeting someone there and like I said, wanted my Asian nachos. Of course, the smell continued and I held my breath while I walked in I rushed to the bathroom and thank god, the bathroom smelled better than the restaurant. And to make everything worse, you removed Asian nachos from your menu!!!! That was the most creative, inventive thing you had on the menu!!! Ok, so not going back. And, yes, the people I was with said the place stunk to high heaven.

qASHgykjUEudtXL86jDTTw.text: The 3 star was for food... I ordered the late-night menu and got the pretzel sticks and chicken tenders. The pretzel sticks were good but the sauce choices were not very tasty. The chicken tenders came out looking beautiful but the batter was very gummy on the inside. Staff seem to be very friendly and helpful. There were no problems with my service and the drinks were made perfectly, I will say the atmosphere was great! I think this would have been a perfect experience except for I showed up a little hungry I was a bit disappointed. Other than that I will give this place another chance.

3IT5cKuruVZkuiap8smb8w.text: I tried this place during lunch, sat at the bar. Just a few people, very low key. Great pub, the fish n chips are awesome, much better that churchill's, which I believe is out of business now. Nice & big, crispy batter, fish nice and flaky. They serve it on top of the chips, and you'll have to ask for tartar. I can't wait to try the Shepherds' pie.

SvAwxDlMW4qyPceYDrRjIQ.text: A good standard "authentic Irish pub". Had the magners cider (wish they had strongbow on tap instead) and cob sandwich. Good drink, good food. My male eating companion said he wasn't sure if they'd cleaned the bathrooms since st patty's day since he's been in alleyways that have smelled better.

BQJE4zJ5V-AhiwPg2nviyQ.text: It's beautiful inside with a ton of wood.  The food was good and so was the beer.  I'm not a fan of trivia night, so depending on your persuasion you may want to schedule around that.   A great place for beer o'clock on St. Patty's day!

gWTV8LjU8GCvqgifhy20mw.text: its a good drinking hole and on occasion its okay to eat at. the real draw is the atmosphere and the crowd. friday and saturday nights are the best of course with live bands and lots of joyful peeps.  sunday brunch is notable. i love their take on the eggs benedict. delish! and the irish bfast is always a winner.  guiness for health!

YmvZg6rcq1IRQNeRIYiLyA.text: Love this place to eat and drink!!  This was a great find.  My favorite point is that they have organic chicken on the menu!  So hard to find.  The food in general is delicious.  I obviously got the chicken which came with mashed and green beans, and my boyfriend got the Sheppard's pie, which he also loved.  The service is great.  They have a ton of t.v.s, as well as pool, darts and video games.  It is very big and draws a nice crowd.  Highly recommend!

MRod4Wjz0IrXKFIsrVIDDA.text: This is a great place to go for the happy hour specials.  The appetizers are half price and everything is delicious.  The hot wings are big and juicy and the garlic fries are great too.  Monday all burgers are $5, a great deal and quite tasty.  The regular menu however, is overpriced and portions are small for the cost.  The mac and cheese at $11 is super tasty but again, the portion is small for what you pay..if that's all you order you will leave hungry.  Same for the Asian salad at $12...the portion was pitifully small for $12...seriously, how much does lettuce cost (my friend subbed lettuce for the cabbage) that they couldn't use enough to make it a meal size serving?  So basically come in for happy hour if you want to eat.  Service has always been decent.  There are only a couple booths in the place so hope you don't mind hard chairs.  The main section is warm and cozy with wood everywhere but the side room is dingy and has an old basement smell.  All in all glad we found this place.

hXcUuhIhqOUZJ8__RG6Hng.text: Really fun place -- great drink and food specials, pretty easy atmosphere, live music was eh, but pub quiz was fun!

cheY3ZlfYq79xWkIEgjVCw.text: While there are many Irish pubs in the Valley, Fibber Magee's is by far the best. With its warm wooden walls, cozy booths and friendly staff, I can't help but feel relaxed when I'm sipping on a Black Velvet at my favorite Chandler bar. The bar attracts a lot of regulars. The drinks won't set your wallet back and the food is great! Be sure to try the Bangers 'N' Mash.

srnUk79dxAFtOcJQfuVU4g.text: Great neighborhood hang out! The food is good, beer is good and  just an all around great place to kick back and have a pint or two! Careful with Trivia night, lots of fun but can get real noisy if you're not into it.

cwxKlq1r0hqC1VER7CRqLQ.text: Irish pubs can be hit or miss, even in Ireland, but especially in the New World. There are plenty of schmucks with green carpet and a shamrock in the window, but few of these places are truly legitimate drink houses.   Inconspicuously tucked into a strip mall in Chandler, Fibber Magee's looks from the parking lot like one of the former. But once you get past the generic exterior, you're highly rewarded with one of the most Irish, wood-paneled, attention-to-detail environments this side of Boston. It's not so much a bar as an actual pub-- a cozy, comfortable establishment where you can also drink cheaply during soccer games, hear a song or two, or generally just get shitfaced. We happened to show up during Monday Night Football, and though the bartender and some patrons were vocally at odds with their rooting interests, everything was kept relatively civil throughout the evening. Though Irish-Americans aren't especially known for their cuisine, the easy-on-the-eyes waitress served up some of the finest corned beef boxty going. The meat was lean and tender, and the whole thing was complemented by a heaven-sent mustard-based sauce. It's a knockout. Eat it. There are plenty of whiskies too, if that's your thing, and if you're here, it may as well be your thing.  All in all, there's not much to complain about. Good food, good drink, comfortable and relatively authentic atmosphere... Fibber Magee's is a total standout. Cheers!

GmrAANAxLcFniolH7NGy8Q.text: Great authentic Irish pub in the middle of the desert.  Great drink selection served from behind a fabulous bar.  Good food and great atmosphere.  Good for lunch time football matches.

smQaBQscMcHbmcYRvLDZuA.text: Love the happy hour drinks, the dark bar and the smoking patio.... and would of given more stars, but yesterday I spent $32 on take out food (ps the menu prices in house are actually higher then those listed on the website- naughty naughty) and recieved an almost $13 steak sandwich with roughly 5 quarter-sized pieces of bland steak, and entire onion and no flavor what so ever. I put the blue cheese on the side so I could have a chance to actually taste the steak only to discover there is a reason there is an over-poweringly flavored spread on the sammy.  Then the fries were soggy and gross.  The chicken tenders were good, battered with their fish and chip batter and the mustard they came with was delicious, but $10 for a chicken tender appetizer.... ouch.  The bread pudding was good, but the one at Famous Dave's is way better, and really, a BBQ joint beating out an Irish pub in the race for the best bread pudding? WTF.  So I guess what Im saying, is if you plan on dinning at Fibber's, skip the menu, get the fish and chips and just get hammered on the patio.  Under no circumstance, order a to-go dinner of much anything else on the menu. Also, I must throw in, I do go here quite a bit, and the wait staff, the music and the people always rock and I always have a good time.  Love the bar staff, love the tap choices, I'll just eat before I go.

wAhcVbEtPUrUk6LPUn3Ygw.text: Awesome food. Great atmosphere. Great live entertainment. Truly a hidden gem in the Chandler area. Can't go wrong with the food nor beers. And the patrons are laid back and fun.

gW_PfgVbjwjvuIwyNFOVHA.text: I've been looking for a neighbor hood bar to call it "my bar" for the longest time, ever since i moved back from california.  The bar tenders takes good care of their guests.  The enviroment is mgnificent, the crowd there is great too.  If you are looking for a good time, and drama free place, Fibber is the place to be.

_9aEsYAvw5vaGaldmKvWag.text: One night I stopped in for a pint and noticed they had a menu that served some traditional Irish fare. So when one of the kids wanted something "different" I took her here. I suggested the traditional Irish breakfast and she agreed. What I didn't tell her is that it includes blood sausage. The wait time for the meal was good and it looked like an Irish breakfast.  I had her try the sausage (which comes in white and black, without blood and with) and she gave me a funny look. Not that it was bad , but it didn't taste how it looked. They put nutmeg or something along that line in it. I could not put my finger on it , but it was different. We also had some shepards pie, which was pretty good. With the wooden decor and the choices of alcohol it is a good place to relax and hang for a while.

uakJScMHTMS5rM9WmUJ6uA.text: I've been going to Fibbers for a couple of years now.  It's a cool Irish bar in Chandler.  I've always really liked the Pub Trivia night they have on Tuesdays and the 2 for 1 drink specials during the Mon-Fri Happy hour are pretty good too.  The food is decent, although a little pricey.  The fish and chips are fantastic and so are the garlic mushrooms.  Clayton the bartender is the bomb!

lustal5DLNcM_vYHgqWXCQ.text: I've spent many a night having fun at Fibber Magee's.  They always have great musicians playing.  I definitely think this place gives Rula Bula on Mill a run for its money!  Sure, it's in Chandler which is not the most happening place around Phoenix, but there sure are plenty of people who live in Chandler that love to go out!  It's about the best place to hang out in Chandler!  The crowd is somewhat monochromatic, but that's what one must expect from an Irish pub.  I spent New Year's Eve here two years ago, and I loved it!  The price included all-you-can-eat and all-you-can-drink for less than $100 per person!  It also included noisemakers, hats, live music and dancing!  So much fun!  This places shares a parking lot with Filiberto's Mexican food, in case you want to stop for a late night snack after the bar closes.

JEZAo6ZxQCSM_Ii184hvhw.text: me  and my husband was in for dinner ,we order the fish all you can eat it was horrible too much grease ,so we order one more hoping the oil get hotter n it not to much grease it worse than the first order the cole slaw was no taste to it , so i went home n call talk to some one in charge his name was Mark he i just tell him that the fish was not good but he did not even care , we thought we order wrong thing cause they look busy but guess wat we do not want to go back or tell friend go there the waitress was not good too DO NOT GO THERE THEY DONOT CARE THEY WANT UR $$$$$$$$ ony

zTWQepOk1__aYEbeiWENGw.text: nice up scale bar food...fish n chips are great but always flabbergasted by the tasteless almost non-existent  cole slaw ..Jen was a good server...

e3JAHx80RpiklErZgtC5cw.text: Fibbers used to be a very nice neighborhood pub, with good food and reasonably priced drinks. The wait staff has recently become so inattentive or indifferent, that I would simply not go back unless it was to sit at the bar. Terrible shame, really, as it was one of my very favorite local watering holes. Hopefully they will turn things around, and hire more waiters/waitresses, or bring in people who care. I will not be returning any time soon.

OFiLObPeGAGONEpdEDp21Q.text: Fibber's is a good time!  I've only eaten there a couple times, but the sheperd's pie was very good, as were the fish and chips and a couple of the appetizers.    Mainly I go there on the weekends to knock back a few pints and see the bands.  The place is really poppin' when the Brazen Heads play, for example, and I don't see all the depressed and downcast people mentioned in one of the earlier reviews.  I don't really get the thing about folks of different ethnicities being treated poorly at Fibber's.  I've been there with black guys and Indian guys, and none of the servers seemed to give a damn about their skin color.  They just poured the beer and collected the money.  I'll be there tonight for the Great Guinness Toast, too!

oN-GD_KetPmCFRVHV8veYw.text: I love Fibbers.  I loved it more before people knew about it but boo hoo now I HAVE to share.  The food is good but there are only two vegi friendly selections.  they usually have good bands and now they have a nice patio so smokers can have thier repreive.  The only bad experience we had here was when my BF lost his sgian dubh and no one was honest enough to turn it in.  Oh and I ate a spring rool that had pork in it (I'm a veg) I threw up all night because of it, but that was my own fault for not asking.  Good food, good bands, great atmosphere, nice patio, good service.

IGo4TU5gZVguyvCj7qrbtA.text: I've been out to Fibber Magee's a couple of times in the last few weeks and I am becoming a fan.  If you are in the mood for a pub/bar, this would be a fine choice.  The service has been consistently good so far, the beer cold and the food tasty.  I've been ordering the fish and chips, which has been mostly good.  The batter on the fish comes out nice and crisp, but can turn a little soggy if it sits on the plate too long.  Even a little soggy it was still edible, but you might eat the fish first to avoid this situation. My only other knock with the fish was that it was extremely greasy, but what else can you expect with fried foods?  The chips are pretty good, but nothing special.  Just your basic shoestring french fries.  While not perfect, the fish and chips was still quite tasty and as long as your not afraid of a little grease you'll probably enjoy them. The drinks were cold and my server made sure that I never ran dry.    Tip: Go for the lunch portion if you can.  The lunch portion is big enough, and the dinner portions tend to be a little pricey for bar food.

XBpfB01oV7ViSTLf9VMPxg.text: Not sure why but my coworkers love this place and we end up doing happy hours here a lot. Place can get pretty packed on a Friday night. I remember a bunch of years back they had boxtys on the menu but that is no longer something you can get here. Bummer! I usually end up getting the Shepherd's Pie and they give you a lot of bang for your buck so I walk out of here quite stuffed. Shepherd's Pie is pretty good - sometimes a bit on the salty side - sorta unpredictable. The Irish brown bread that comes with it is awesome though. Who knew that a few slices of bread with butter on it can bring such joy?? Beer selection is pretty decent - changes from week to week. Fridays usually there's a band playing. Keltic Cowboys are good. One night was trivia night. Another night was ska night which was cool until a brawl broke out. I think that might have soured some of us on this place because we haven't been back since. But I'm sure I'll be back someday. Closest Irish pub to where I live. Lotsa parking as it's in a mall.

shj5cj59jhJ83LOv8LJYYw.text: While many people might think of Fibber's in relation to St. Patty's day, it's more than just a seasonal spot to visit. They have a good beer list, a decent happy hour and unique food you won't find everywhere. I've also been there for a birthday party where the side room of the bar was rented. It's worth checking out.

3XnEuG4k1_zmY84W5PgYog.text: Good food traditional surroundings  friendly staff the only thing wrong with this place is the music, I expected Irish music to be played at an Irish pub

zCM5_4yy9EV7l7LBRFsFqg.text: My husband and I really used to love this place for a nearby, walking distance mini date night...  but I feel the bar part of it has really gone downhill over the last year or 2. Yes, the atmosphere is great-- a dimly lit Irish Pub . The food I've had is decent too. The drinks on the other hand, are over priced and badly made . I should clarify that I'm not a huge drinker, just like to go out once in a while for a couple of drinks while shooting some pool or throwing some darts. But when you pay anywhere from $6-7 for a mix drink, and you can't even taste the alcohol, that is a rip off, pure and simple. And also, good luck getting a consistent price. I went there one night with a friend from out of town, and we had 3 drink each, the same drink every time. the first round was $13, the second round was $12 (hardly tasting the rum in either) , the next round was happy hour so it was a bit less, but then it tasted like pure mixer with literally 0 alcohol. And yes, we tipped well, regardless, so it shouldn't have been a retaliatory thing.  We resolved that since we like the atmosphere and that it is nearby, we would just get beer from now on... Then they raised the price on draft beers too... I feel like they are relying on their well known name and loyalty from people who want a decent place to come to, but they'd  probably get more quantity of business if they focused on quality. We definitely come here less often lately.

t_XtcHYnQj7951sxMl5a1g.text: I happened on this place on a Sunday afternoon. They had an Irish music jam session going and some of the patrons were dancing a jig. Honest!   Good tap beer selection. Good fish n Chips, Good service. Unbelievably good atmosphere when the jam session is happening.

HPWjSQqWDQfIMaH0pPjbZQ.text: family of five went there wednesday night. several websites state kids eat free Wednesdays.  we asked our server was that still the case and NO was the answer. felt jipped. food was decent  bar had nice styling

KqNzppUjprB-yzwV2qKzpg.text: I would actually give this place four and a half stars, as the service is patchy at time, though always friendly. With their daily specials and the the great atmosphere, you really can't go wrong stopping in for a meal, or just for drinks. No one to go with? No worries! Everyone I have met there is super friendly, and you won't feel alone! The menu has something for everyone, and I have yet to order anything that wasn't really tasty!

ULtoxWGkV2Gk4DXODHZETQ.text: My favorite neighborhood pub and weekend hangout is Fibber Magees in Chandler. Irish owned and operated, they offer delectable irish cuisine and only the finest beer. If you enjoy live music check out the weekend entertainment.   It's kinda like Cheers to me and my friends...I think do actually know all our names!

iujXRP4vmoSfBUoaEdZ3fA.text: This place has some of the best Irish food around. The Shepard's Pie is great as is the Bangers N Mash.   The atmosphere feels authentic and inviting. It is not expensive either.

rQGjrqMcXqVe0dnuzLBmSA.text: best irish bar in the world!!! great music and the food is second to none. awesome service and great drinks.

W9ygDjUnpiTccI0j6RcX3Q.text: Another place I am THRILLED to be in walking distance of. I love this spot! Great beers on tap which makes me happy and I love me some fried mushrooms to snack on while I'm there as for foodI really have only had a salad there, which was good... it was a salad... ya know? I can't say anything about the rest of the menu.  I must add that I loathe St.Patrick's day every year BUT only because it royally screws with traffic when I'm trying to get home. This place is poppin every year! It's totally the place to be. =)

-nitriw2j9MtG4in5ct6sA.text: Lovely place! It's a very cozy and friendly place to eat and drink. It definitely looks and feels like a real pub! Worth checking out (I recommend the blue cheese salad).

iEIXEmOIK7i_q3bkMka5Wg.text: I love going here on Wednesday nights at 8 to listen to the live music they have (they have a singer named Holly) because it's wonderful!!  They serve half-price flatbread pizzas all night, I recommend the braised rib one.  Delicious!

WQ_zVqHYBfboz3eVXEBtDQ.text: My new local beer spot.  Had happy hour the other day.  Four beers, a large dish of wings, and flat bread, all very good.  I had only been twice before and didn't realize how big the back area and patio are.  Good service, chill atmosphere, my kind of place.  Only suggestion would to maybe add a few more TV's as I would make it my Football spot in the fall time.

AQ2aDahAaAGTHnb-fennCA.text: Solid shepherd's pie and they have HP sauce (bonus). Amicable service and the bartender even waited an extra 30 seconds to ring me up so happy hour prices would apply. Looking forward to going back to check the live music.

O0FP_kbB1yTkXr5xbrg8fA.text: In the area on business and did a search on the net for Irish bars in the area. Glad I found this one. The bartenders Will and Ken were friendly and attentive. Will, who I found out later was the owner, knows how to pour a perfect Guinness. The pork tacos were very good and I will def be back to try some of the other food selections also. I also liked the fact that besides the standard Irish beers that they also had some craft beers on tap. Just a great, friendly place that I will be frequenting again while here on business.

UVX4AoJA_Wp57rvsafA5ZA.text: I came here once before a long time ago for a birthday bash. Because of the large size of the party, we were relegated to a large room separate from the rest of the bar.  At the time I thought it was good, very crowded and fun atmosphere.  As I was facing a white wall during most of the somewhat uncomfortable evening (ie My brother's friends, my Grandma and lots of booze), I barely noticed all the beautiful woodwork in the main bar area. I have been there twice this week.  Once for a nightcap and a second time for take out.  Both were very enjoyable. The nightcap was after midnight and a few stragglers were ramped up and kinda vocal, but otherwise a friendly and warm atmosphere.  I minded my own business and discovered a drawing application I my phone which kept me entertained.  The Vodka soda was fine with fresh lime.  Bartender was friendly and did not try to rush anyone out- it was getting late and yet he was still relaxed and attentive. Today i picked up a turkey avacado sandwhich and it was great!  Thinly sliced Turkey w/ sliced avacado and Bacon on a nice roll.  Some tomatoes and lettuce and it was perfect.   I recommend checking this place out for both the food and the casual atmosphere.

ottEM8iX2ps8lHTNrgYp4g.text: Worst bar tenders in east valley. Ten minutes to get a drink. Rude bartenders who look like they were lucky to be hired

ZpY_NH3ueowabhYUv5ddfw.text: Great beer selection, food was so-so. Most of the dishes are too oily and salty.  Laid back ambience. Staff was friendly and helpful. I'd come here to social and hang out with friends or colleagues, but not for dinner.

9siFPMNtsxE8v4YnU9HsCw.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. The staff is genuinely friendly, the liquor selection is top notch, and the food is delicious! Bread pudding, and Irish Nachos are two of my guilty pleasures that can't be missed.

GKQlJV-1sqSpr93hgMoRLg.text: Football Sunday and we stopped in to try and catch the end of the Green Bay Packer game. Granted this bar is known for being a Seahawks bar, but we've been in here numerous times and seen tv's on with multiple games showing. Not today! The bar was not filled with patrons when we kindly asked if one of the end tv's could be turned to see the end of the Packer game...but the bartender said the Seahawks game will be starting soon. Um buddy, "soon" means it is not on yet and the previous game is not over so why not? I think my words were "you've got to be kidding" as I angrily left that establishment. We used to like this place since it is close to our house but today it was clearly not a place to go unless you were a Seahawks fan and didn't care about any other game that was still taking place.

xqfLVQdWX3kyzdLkP1VpQQ.text: Went in on Sunday around 4 (10/28) The place is nice, and Fish and chips were good.   But........Bartender was an un-inviting, un-helpful just overall unwelcoming jerk.   Would not come back just for the chance of having to deal with that guy. Left a bad taste in my mouth, that overrode the fish and chips.

hTMsNVKwmgEnF0blmJr3BA.text: Great Irish food the wait staff is friendly and very helpful it's a great place to hang out and on Sundays they have an Irish Session

JiBgNTPK6flCMSF9QC2m6g.text: This place is great for happy hour. Appetizers are half off and drinks are also $1.50 off with other additional specials. The appetizers menu has a good selection to chose from. I am obsessed with their dirty Nellie's, pretzels and flat breads.   My favorite beer is the snake bite which has a good kick to it and goes straight to your head. Fridays are all you can eat fish and chips with a side of coleslaw and tartar sauce for $14, totally worth it when you have an appetite. Live music is also available in friday nights and Saturday nights.  The environment is welcoming and staff is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dirty Nelly&#39;s $5 during hh
Photo of Fibber Magees - Chandler, AZ, United States. Meatloaf

XMxtPcZLZIOdix7mMM1yJg.text: Irish Breakfast all day anytime (can't beat that) and top of that Carlsberg (One of finest and best beer with least preservatives) on tap even better. Love the atmosphere, food, beer choices and Irish music not to forget live Irish Music from 4p to 6p on Sun. Now they have trivia on Mon too. Been going to Fibber's for over 12 years especially for Soccer and friendly, welcoming staff. If you happen to be there when the bartender is Dave, Alex or Kendra are there its a A+ and its even better. Thanks Dave, Alex and Kendra as always for treating us like Fibber family and welcoming us.  (Miss seeing Matt since he is at Skeptical Chemist (their Sister Bar) also Vanessa and Tony.  I like food choicea from Dirty Nellies to Shepherds Pie and Lamb Nachos topped with Jalapenos not to forget Mussels and Belfast burger. I can eat Irish breakfast anytime along with delicious dessert of Chocolate cake with ice cream. Don't forget to visit on St Patrick's Day and countdown clock is in there to give you some planning time.

fW4G7Uaq8xH7U_Q3dskgRQ.text: Loved this place. The cod sliders are amazing. The dirty nellies are definitely a guilty pleasure. The house made chips that are the base of the nellies are nice and crispy. The service was great too, our waitress was very attentive and made sure we always had drinks.

sv9qualLFYPAmLTSXNmACA.text: We were a group of six and it was our first time here.  Food and drinks exceeded our expectations and the service was great.  Friendly and welcoming

Y6g9h9Idd3wsTnFQDjFD-Q.text: Tried this place out while meeting friends for happy hour Friday evening.   Fantastic and plentiful happy hour drink specials! Had specials on beer, mixed drinks and shots. I was starving so I skipped the happy hour snacks and ordered a burger. I got the Belfast Burger and it was sooo good! The beef patty tasted great. Good quality. Excellent flavor.   Service was great. Prices were about right. They even had some ladies going around giving promo shots of whiskey. Great timing on our part!   Def would go back.

jO1DCI8EVZZtsmVMaPAG7Q.text: Totally cool joint! Classic Irish pub even with live music! We came here Friday night for some food around 8 PM. There was a fun band playing some type of something that really added to the pub feel.   They offer some good beer on tap, particularly a Scottish one. Our friends recommended the burgers, so I ordered the peppercorn burger with a fried egg on it. I have never had a burger with an egg on it... turned out to be a great idea! The burger was cooked perfectly to what I wanted and the service was good.   Side note: this is a seahawks bar! More brownie points. Haha.   Really laid back bar to come for a good burger and beer.
